comments: Maintain a stable head position throughout the swing.
Focus on a fuller rotation in the follow-through.
Reduce lateral sway in the backswing.
Aim for a more complete hip and chest rotation in the finish.
Keep your left arm straighter through impact.
Let your hips lead the downswing more actively.

highlights: Consistent tempo, especially on the last swing.
Solid contact achieved on the final swing.
improvements: Improve lower body stability during the backswing to minimize sway.
Increase body rotation through impact to enhance power and consistency.
Work on maintaining a straighter lead arm through the impact zone.

lines.text: Alright, let's take a look at your golf swing.
Starting with your setup, try to maintain a consistent spine angle.
In your backswing, aim for a more stable lower body to avoid any lateral sway.
Through impact, focus on rotating your hips and chest fully towards the target.
Notice how a slight sway in the backswing can affect your balance.
Work on extending your lead arm more fully through the ball.
Now for your third swing, which looked much better.
That's a stronger backswing position, good coil.
Excellent contact! See how your body rotated better here, leading to a straighter shot.
Overall, you have good clubhead speed and a solid tempo, especially on that last swing.
To improve further, focus on minimizing lower body sway in the backswing.
Also, emphasize a more active hip and chest rotation through impact to maximize power and consistency.
